title: NASA and IBM Release AI Model to Predict Dangerous Solar Weather
raw_excerpt: Open-source Surya model analyzes solar data to forecast space weather impacts on Earth's critical infrastructure
raw_body: Open-source Surya model analyzes solar data to forecast space weather impacts on Earth's critical infrastructure
speedrun: NASA and IBM have unveiled the Surya model, an open-source AI tool designed to predict hazardous solar weather events. This model analyzes solar data to assess potential impacts on Earth's critical infrastructure, marking a significant advancement in space weather forecasting and its implications for technology-dependent systems.
why_it_matters: The Surya model enhances our ability to prepare for solar storms, potentially protecting satellites, power grids, and communication systems from disruptions caused by space weather.
By making the model open-source, it encourages collaboration and innovation in the field, allowing researchers and organizations worldwide to improve their own forecasting capabilities.

lenses.eli12: NASA and IBM created a new tool called the Surya model that helps predict dangerous solar weather. This is cool because it can protect things like satellites and power lines from solar storms, which can cause big problems for everyone.
lenses.pm: The Surya model will be used by space agencies, utility companies, and telecommunications firms to mitigate risks associated with solar weather. It addresses the challenge of forecasting solar events, providing a competitive edge in safeguarding infrastructure and minimizing downtime.
lenses.engineer: The Surya model employs advanced machine learning techniques to analyze vast amounts of solar data, predicting space weather events with improved accuracy. Its architecture is designed for scalability and real-time analysis, though it may face limitations in processing speed during extreme solar activity.
